results.title: Strange friends = Mo sheng de peng you
results.creator_credit: Me Wenru, Xu Lei and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
On a train from Beijing to Fuzhou, passengers are chatting to kill time on the long journey. Sitting next to Du and Zhang is a quiet lady who looks worried. The two young men try to find a common topic with the lady but their efforts are in vein. At night, Zhang noticed that the lady was smoking with tears in her eyes. Feeling suspected by others, the lady got off in the middle of the journey and was overwhelmed by distressful memories of her past when she was interrogated by the police and threatened by her gangsters. The lady went to the Yangtze river and wanted to commit suicide. However, Zhang has followed her to the river and persuaded her to go with him. On their way to Fuzhou, Zhang learned that the lady became the scapegoat of a crime and felt sympathetic for her. By the time they reach Fuzhou, awaiting them at the train station are two cadres who confirm that the lady is clear and will take her home. Du and Zhang see off the lady on the platform. As the train starts to move, the lady asks for contact details of Zhang. Du hands over a magazine to her, saying it’s all in it. The lady sees Zhang’s photo and next to it is an article entitled “From a criminal to a model worker”.

This was the first PRC (People’s Republic of China) film that won a major international award at the Berlin Film Festival. In 1985, the director of the film, Xu Lei produced a 12-episode TV series which also dealt with the reformation of young criminals. Viewers interested in this film may also like ‘Juvenile Delinquents’. Xu Lei also directed Tears Shed in Taipei (1993). (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Straford video memories
results.creator_credit: John Straford, Frank Straford and Inala Video
results.brief_description:
Video memories of the Victorian west coast and bushfires in the north-east produced by the Straford family.
“Gone to blazes” contains footage broadcast by national and commercial TV channels during the course of the devastating bushfires that ravaged the Victorian north-east early in 2003.

results.title: Strange fits of passion
results.creator_credit: Elise McCredie, Lucy MacLaren, Meridian Films, Film Victoria, Arena and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This is the bittersweet story of a young woman’s journey to discovering the meaning of love, sex and desire in a post modern world. Obsessed with falling in love and losing her virginity, the protagonist is irresistibly drawn to the enigmatic Francis, who she meets working in a second-hand bookshop. She embarks on a compulsive journey to find him which sees her through a series of hilarious sexual and social misadventures. Cast includes: Michela Noonan, Mitchell Butel, Samuel Johnson, Steve Adams and Anni Finsterer.

results.title: Strange days [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Steven-Charles Jaffe, James Cameron and Lightstorm Entertainment
results.brief_description: Los Angeles. December 29, 1999 - the lead up to the new millennium. The city is close to anarchy, with crime and racial tensions creating an ever present sense of danger. Lenny Nero (Ralph Fiennes) is an ex-cop who now deals in illegal SQUIDS, CD-discs of memory/experiences used like a virtual reality game where the user gets to experience moments recorded from someone’s cerebral cortex. When Lenny’s friend Iris is murdered and he receives a SQUID clip of the incident, he stumbles into a web of killing and police corruption which involves his ex-girlfriend, rock singer Faith Justin (Juliette Lewis) and her gangster manager/lover Philo Gant (Michael Wincott). With help from friends Mace (Angela Bassett) and Max (Tom Sizemore), Lenny tries to find out who is behind the murders whilst not being killed himself. Written by James Cameron in collaboration with former film critic Jay Cocks, “Strange days” has strong performances from Ralph Fiennes and Angela Bassett who have a lot of fun with the role reversals - Lenny is a hopeless hero whilst Mace is the strong, heroic action heroine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathryn Bigelow, Steven-Charles Jaffe, James Cameron and Lightstorm Entertainment

results.title: Strand: under the dark cloth
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Telefilm Canada and John Walker Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary about modernist photographer Paul Strand (1890-1976), one of the seminal figures in the history of photography. Strand broke with the romantic pictorialist tradition to create a direct, dynamic photographic aesthetic. He was one of the first American artists to fully understand cubism, translating its vocabulary to the medium of photography. From 1914 onwards, Strand’s groundbreaking work encompassed abstract compositions, candid portraits, extreme close-ups of nature and documentation of social conditions. He was also a filmmaker and in 1921 he made America’s first avant-garde film, “Manhatta”, with painter Charles Sheeler. His growing political commitment, especially during and after the Great Depression, led him to embrace filmmaking as a means of political expression. In 1934 he became involved with a group of radical New York filmmakers, collaborating with Pare Lorentz on “The Plow that broke the plains” in 1936 and with Leo Hurwitz on “Native land”, a visually remarkable indictment of American civil rights abuses in 1941. The documentary contains interviews with Georgia O’Keefe, Milton Brown, Fred Zinnemann, Leo Hurwitz, Virginia Stevens, Hazel Strand, Cesare Zavattini, Blanche Brown and Walter Rosenblum. The titles “Native land” and “The plow that broke the plains” available on VHS.

results.title: Straight from the heart
results.creator_credit: Frances Reid, Dee Mosbacher, Straight from the Heart and Woman Vision (USA)
results.brief_description: This program examines the issues parents face in coming to terms with a gay or lesbian child. It presents interviews with parents and children and tackles issues in a positive and thought provoking manner including the diagnosis of a child with HIV or AIDS. Academy Award Nominee, Documentary Short Subject Category, 1995.

results.title: Taming the red swamp
results.brief_description: Vision only. Film seems to be about the techniques employed to make waterlogged land usable for crops. Footage includes old-style farm vehicles and machinery being used to achieve this. Nice shot of 6 new red tractors driving through the terrain. Also features an amusing moment where two men push a large poll into the ground to prove how soft the soil is. General shots of cattle are scattered throughout. Nice, kitsch begining and end illustrated titles. Good ‘The End’, possibly for postcard.
